Content: The Gemara continues: Canaan commanded his sons with regard to five matters that are apparently normal behavior for slaves: Love one another, love robbery, love promiscuity, hate your masters, and do not speak the truth.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: For Thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and love her dust.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: and showing mercy unto the thousandth generation of them that love Me and keep My commandments.
Shemayah and Avtalyon received from them. Shemayah says, "Love work, hate lordship and do not become familiar with the government."

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: He hath brought me to the banqueting-house, And his banner over me is love.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And he said: I love thee, O LORD, my strength.

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: But he who sins against me despoils his soul; all who hate me love death.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I love them that love me, And those that seek me earnestly shall find me.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Come, let us sate ourselves with love until the morning; let us rejoice in love-making.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, And that I may fill their treasuries.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: ’Stay ye me with dainties, refresh me with apples; For I am love-sick.’

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: I love that the LORD should hear my voice and my supplications.
Any love that is dependent on something, when that thing perishes, so too does the love. [A love]r that is not dependent on something, does not ever perish. What's an example of a love that is

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Better is open rebuke Than love that is hidden.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: A lovely hind and a graceful doe, Let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; With her love be thou ravished always.
